result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jamey L. Podoll in court.  Court questions DE.  He was just fired from his job on 3/11/2015.  Court questions why DE didn't qualify for PD appt.  DE states it's because his name is on the mortgage still.  Court finds DE conditionally indigent and appts Atty Maura Melka.  To reimburse COC's office $25/week beginning on 3/27/2015 and then every Friday thereafter.  Bond continued.
Return date on March 20, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jamey L. Podoll in court.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaints.  Advised rights to an attorney.  DE notes he has Atty Melka in another matter in Columbia Co but not here in Sauk Co.  $1,000.00 signature bond set in 15CF75 and $600.00 signature bond set in 15CM87.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking today in both matters.  Return date scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
